s.text: We see nerds at work, nerds at play (which is to say, at work), nerds in love, and of course some nerd humor.

Because Macintosh users want Macintosh programs, not warmed-over Windows programs.

The lowest-common-denominator approach its creators take to solving the problems of today's heterogeneous computer systems is highly controversial, and not just because Microsoft and Intel (who have the most to lose if the Java approach wins out) say so.
For La Honda director Hank Menzinger, it's a way to change the world without doing the actual work himself.
Even when our start-up friends go out on their own, they are doing it because it's the only way to get things done.
Where $20 Million succeeds is as a character study.
Where $20 Million succeeds is as a character study.
The misanthropic engineers, the monotonic human-resource drones, the evangelistic marketers, even the nontechnical but talented girlfriend all strike painfully home.
